title: Designer
description: Company Description Mechanism is an early-stage venture firm that partners with entrepreneurs to launch and scale ambitious companies. In our model, we work to identify and validate opportunities before creating every business. We then provide the growth expertise to gain early traction as well as the business support to establish positive unit economics, profitability, and scale. In addition to investment and strategic guidance, we offer extensive operational support for our startups in critical areas, including Growth, Product, Design, Operations, People, Finance, and Legal. Our in-house experts are at the top of their fields and are here to provide world-class support and expertise helping our startups get off the ground and scale.As a team, we have deep expertise across growth marketing, and it’s an important part of our company-wide culture. When it comes to launching and scaling companies, we don’t guess. We engineer.Our success rate of getting companies profitable is 100%, and our team has a track record of investing in and cofounding multiple companies with $100M+ revenue.Position DescriptionWe are seeking a talented and experienced freelance designer with a strong focus on revenue growth, branding, and marketing design. In this role, you will be responsible for creating visually stunning and user-friendly digital touchpoints that drive conversions and support our growth marketing initiatives. Your expertise in both design principles, branding, and marketing strategies will be essential in elevating our portfolio companies’ online presence and maximizing revenue opportunities. You’ll work closely with our product team and our portfolio companies’ internal teams. If you are passionate about creating impactful designs that attract and engage users, while optimizing for business growth, we would love to have you on our team.What Youll Do Learn about our portfolio companies markets and their user demographics: Gain a deep understanding of the markets in which our portfolio companies operate and familiarize yourself with the unique characteristics and preferences of their target audiences. This knowledge will help you create designs that effectively resonate with and engage their specific user demographics. Bring portfolio companies brands, platforms, and websites (marketing and e-commerce) to the next level: Elevate the visual identity and user experience of our portfolio companies brands and websites. Collaborate with the growth marketing teams to develop design strategies that align with their overall goals and enhance brand recognition, while ensuring a cohesive and seamless user experience across all touchpoints. Create landing pages, user acquisition flows, and SEO pages: Design compelling landing pages and user surveys and quizzes that drive conversions and capture leads. Utilize your understanding of SEO best practices to optimize the website pages for search engine visibility and improve organic traffic. Ensure that the landing pages and SEO pages are visually appealing, user-friendly, and aligned with the marketing objectives of the portfolio companies. Collaborate with the portfolio companies’ CEOs and product teams to conduct A/B testing of different design solutions. Use data-driven insights to evaluate the performance of various designs, iterate on them, and refine the user experience. By continuously experimenting and optimizing, you will contribute to improving conversion rates and overall user engagement. Conduct usability tests to gather feedback on the usability and intuitiveness of website designs. Conduct user interviews to gain insights into user behavior, preferences, and pain points. Apply the insights gathered from these activities to refine and enhance the user experience, ensuring that the designs effectively meet the needs and expectations of the target audience. Leverage AI and tools to support your design and research efforts. This may include using AI-powered analytics tools to gain insights from user data, utilizing AI-driven design tools to automate repetitive tasks, or employing AI-based algorithms to personalize user experiences. Stay up-to-date with emerging AI trends and incorporate them into your design process to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Who You Are You are humble. You operate with intellectual honesty and check our egos at the door. You are receptive, adaptable, and we help each other succeed. You are fast. You optimize for speed of learning, execution, and growth. You do not get blocked easily. You are data-driven. You trust data over intuition. You don’t guess. You engineer. You are an overachiever. You partner with CEOs as cofounders and go all in. You know start-up life is not 9-5 and that excites you. You drive your own accountability and take pride in doing great work. A win for a portfolio company is a win for Mechanism. You play the long game. You do the things today that will help us tomorrow. You optimize for the long-term enterprise value (EV) of Mechanism portfolio companies and know significant companies take years to build. You are passionate. You actively promote a positive, high-energy culture of high performance, connection, and trust. You believe life is short, so you enjoy it and do what you love. What Youll Bring Proven experience as a Growth Designer, preferably in a revenue-focused or marketing-driven environment. Experience with Google Analytics and design tools such as Figma, Adobe CS, and FullStory. Strong understanding of UX/UI principles and ability to create visually appealing, user-friendly designs that align with marketing goals. Knowledge of responsive design principles and experience in designing websites for optimal performance across various devices and screen sizes. Solid understanding of SEO principles and best practices and the ability to implement SEO strategies into website designs. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, content, and development teams. Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset to evaluate the effectiveness of designs and make data-informed optimizations. Ability to context switch effectively and manage multiple projects simultaneously. A keen eye for detail and a passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging design techniques. Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with the ability to collaborate effectively with developers for seamless implementation. Location and Time CommitmentWe are fully remote - you can work wherever you’re most productive. This role is freelance, and meetings will need to overlap with US EST.

title: Graphic (Marketing) Designer
description: IntroductionWe are seeking a highly creative and talented Visual Designer to assist our marketing team. As a Visual Designer, you will play a crucial role in shaping our brand identity and creating visually compelling marketing materials to support our business objectives.Responsibilities Design engaging and impactful marketing materials, including report covers, social graphics, web pages, one sheets, white papers, and other visual marketing assets. Develop and maintain a consistent brand image across all marketing materials. Generate fresh ideas and innovative design concepts that align with our brand guidelines. Ensure designs are optimized for various channels and platforms, including digital and print. Conduct design reviews and incorporate feedback to refine designs. Requirements Proven work experience as a Visual Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your creative skills. Proficiency in industry-standard design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Knowledge of Canva is a plus. Solid understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout composition. Experience designing marketing materials for digital and print mediums with strong attention to detail Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively present and explain design concepts. Candidates regularly available during US working hours will be given priority. How to ApplyIf you have a passion for design, a keen eye for detail, and a portfolio that showcases your expertise, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your portfolio and a brief cover letter explaining why you are interested in this position and how your skills and experience align with our requirements.

title: Lead Designer
description: We are looking for a creative graphic designer with experience in leading creative teams, designing and building emails in Klaviyo.You will work closely with our email marketing specialists and copywriters to design email campaigns, opt-in forms, templates, and other graphic materials for email. Your job will be to use a client’s style guide or brand book to create compelling email templates and campaigns.You will be working on many different projects for some of the fastest-growing eCommerce businesses in the country. You’ll be able to play with new design styles, try different visual approaches, and constantly think outside the box.We have a page devoted to our favorite emails from completed campaigns. It represents our baseline expectations for a new graphic designer’s ability: https://flowium.com/desig.Responsibilities Manage team of designers: hiring, training, providing feedback, preparing and conducting regular trainings in creative teams. Develop and build graphic materials for our client’s email campaigns and flows in Klaviyo. Design & develop email templates, including icon / UI creation and GIFs Design, then build email templates directly in the Klaviyo builder (No hard-coded HTML) QA testing emails (dark mode, mobile, outlook, etc.) Design banners and other graphics using copy provided by our team of copywriters Required Experience & Skills 3-5 years of experience in leading creative teams. Abilities in sharing knowledge, leading trainings and being a coach. Motivational skills. Expert-level experience in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, or similar. Understanding of dark mode and how to QA test and adjust email designs accordingly. Detail-oriented with a great eye for design—you can follow brand guides, content outlines, copy documents, etc. Knowledge of HTML/CSS to pull clients’ colors and fonts from their web pages (no coding needed). Ability to prioritize your workload to accommodate clients that need a quick turnaround. Open to feedback and critique—you should be curious and excited to improve. Ability to work comfortably with brand guides and style guides without direct client interaction. How To ApplyWe’re skipping traditional phone interviews to save us all a little time and are instead asking candidates to fill out the following application, which should take about 30 minutes to complete.Only candidates who complete the entire form will be considered.We can’t wait to hear from you! https://flowium.com/career/lead-designer/

title: Senior Designer
description: Harley & Co. is an award-winning, internationally recognized creative and entertainment studio that specializes in media properties, experiences, identity design and narrative content. We work at the crossroads of audio/video series, campaigns, physical installations and graphic design. We are looking for a senior designer who is creative, talented with an eye for typography, design and layout. The senior designer should be someone who loves to use design to tell complex stories that shift culture. They should have a passion for film, photography, typography and contemporary ways to apply graphic design. They should believe that design, if used well, can be a transformative tool for change. This job requires someone who is endlessly curious and loves learning new things. You should bring proficient skills within the Adobe Suite (Photoshop and Illustrator, InDesign required) C4D and after effect knowledge is a plus as you will be creating design assets across multiple platforms. The company currently operates on a remote basis with all employees and has a centrally located headquarters in New York City. Responsibilities: · Easily adapt and add to our company philosophy – think differently, constantly evolve/elevate your work, inspire the team, and lead by example getting hands on with the work· Come from a mindset of earning your spot. Developing big ideas within practical considerations that connect to culture.· Collaborate with our Creative Director and Senior Art Director to execute brand vision for our clients· Have strong understanding of how to shape narratives, and an appreciation for strategic thinking· Get into the details, review & refine briefs, understand project plans & staffing, and be constantly thinking about how to set the team up for success What You Bring:● Bachelor Degree in Design, minimum 5-7 years of experience● Comfort working across discipline● Proficiency in Adobe Suite - Photoshop and Illustrator required - InDesign, and After Effects a plus.● Print experience with strong typography and layout skills● Ability to take feedback and learn from experts in the field of design and creative thinking What We Value:● Compassion: Empathy for the people our work supports and our colleagues● Curiosity: A continuous ambition to learn and apply new knowledge/techniques cross platforms● Adaptability: Ability to wear multiple hats and working outside of your comfort zone● Composure & Poise: A level-minded demeanor through client feedback and fast working conditions

title: UX / UI Digital Product Designer
description: Job Description: Junior to Mid UX UI Digital Product Designer at OCTO-EULocation: Lyon, France (Headquarters based in Providence RI, USA)About OCTO and the role:OCTO Product Development is a nimble research, product and software development group built on the idea that high quality design work comes from the combination of experience, intuition, and an engaging workplace to support innovation.As a small but growing firm, we offer a unique opportunity for a junior to mid UX/UI designer to take on diverse projects and responsibilities. At OCTO, we embrace a non-corporate environment where creativity knows no bounds. We value creativity and believe design thinking is not just something for designers.Our primary focus is on industrial tech and manufacturing tech clients, as well as med tech, green tech, blue tech, and energy tech, serving clients worldwide, but primarily in the US and Europe. As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with clients and our internal senior members, integrating seamlessly to help us deliver outstanding project results. We encourage self-starters who are comfortable with flexibility, turning projects around on tight deadlines, and enjoy working in an environment that encourages a balance between work and hobbies. Collaborating with our team members who come from a diverse range of career backgrounds and our wide range of client types makes OCTO a great place to test the waters in many industries and stay in the know of cutting-edge of tech advancements.Responsibilities: Being a master of Figma. This is our main production tool for building full spec product as well as releasing clickable prototypes. Expect to keep apprised of software features and updates to utilize best functionality, we love to hear about new plug-ins and shortcuts! Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including clients, to define and develop compelling user experiences, concepts, and strategies for softwares and apps, saas products, workshops, and events / expos experiences etc. Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate design concepts and interactions. Help to conduct product research, user testing, and analysis to inform design decisions and ensure optimal user experiences. Collaborate with our internal team to create visually stunning and intuitive user experience and interfaces that align with our clients brand identities and project goals. Contribute to build and maintain design libraries and component libraries in Figma to facilitate collaboration and ensure design consistency. Track and manage design tasks and projects using agile project management tools such as Jira or Notion and slack + client communication networks. Utilize design softwares such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Lightroom, After Effects etc, and keynote + powerpoint to create captivating visuals and presentations as needed. Foster strong client relationships and confidently present design concepts to client groups and stakeholders. Demonstrate a solid knowledge base of front-end coding functionality to collaborate effectively with developers. Requirements: A portfolio and resume showcasing your outstanding visual storytelling skills and expertise in UX/UI design. Proven experience and strong skills in user experience design, user interface design, user flows, product architecture and wireframes, persona building and user research. Proficiency in Figma for creating screens, prototypes, and libraries. Familiarity with collaborative project mapping / brainstorming tools like Miro / Figjam etc. Fluency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Keynote, and PowerPoint. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with remote and local teams. Experience in client relations and confidently presenting design concepts to stakeholders and to internal teams. Solid understanding of frontend coding functionality. A flexible mindset with the ability to adapt to ever evolving project requirements and to fill in various roles. Fluent English is a must, bonus if you speak French or other languages! Bonus skills and nice to haves we love: Print graphic production knowledge. Drawing and illustration skills. Basic motion graphics / animation / video editing skills in After effects, Premier pro, Cinema 4d, etc. a plus Coding skills are great if you like to occasionally help build UI or do QA with out resident head of dev. Past experiences designing for physical space and or convention / expos etc. and on the ground event collaboration. Experience working in XR (Extended Reality), AR (Augmented Reality), VR (Virtual Reality) experience design as we are extending our work in this field. Bonus for working in game engines such as Unity etc. Experience in 3D design with Blender, 3ds max, Cinema 4d etc., Zbrush or keyshot, Solidworks. We do a lot of physical work as well and for XR. Social media skills (we admit we are not the best at this, but were getting there). Join OCTO-EU:If you are a talented and versatile junior to mid UX/UI designer looking for a challenging and creative environment, OCTO offers an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects in various industries. We value your unique perspective and encourage you to bring your creativity and problem-solving skills to our team. Apply now!Send us your portfolio and resume to check out at jobs@octopd.com

title: Graphic Designer on Retainer
description: Pineapple Products, Inc. is a fully remote, fast growing E-commerce company that sells direct-to-consumer health supplements online. We doubled sales in each of the last 4 years and are committed to bringing new, innovative products to the market. We are seeking a Graphic Designer on retainer to help us complete some mission critical projects. Heres what we think is needed for success in this role:Objectives of this role Work on a wide range of projects and media, using various software programs to visualize and develop innovative graphic designs that meet business goals Obtain input from managers to ensure that designs meet organizational standards and brand expectations, express ideas accurately, and represent the company or client appropriately Work independently as well as cooperatively with marketing team to meet deadlines and schedule project implementation based on workload, which may include five or more simultaneous projects Update and maintain internal databases for designs, photography, and video Responsibilities Translate strategic direction into high-quality design within an established brand identity Develop concepts by hand or with software, and execute original content by determining the ideal usage of color, text, font style, imagery, and layout Manage the design and uploading process for all project materials, based on best practices for using a content management system Use trend intelligence and knowledge of historical and current markets when designing and executing specific classifications Common types of projects include (but are not limited to): supplement labels, 3D mockups of supplement packaging, web design resources for sales pages, Amazon and E-commerce asset creation. Required skills and qualifications Exceptional creativity and innovative design skills Five or more years of experience (academic and professional) with design software, including Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, & Figma Excellent communication and presentation skills Organizational and time-management skills for meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment Accept a retainer fee in exchange for last-minute and time-sensitive projects Occasionally turn around projects within a short period of time Supplement Label Compliance Regulations 3D Rendering Abilities, specifically bottle rendering for product photos on our website Preferred skills and qualifications Three or more years of experience in professional graphic design, preferably with a creative or marketing agency Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in graphic design, art, or related discipline Working knowledge of CSS3, HTML5, and JavaScript Knowledge of content management systems Photography experience and proficiency with photo-editing software

title: Creating a signature
description: Hello there, i have a pdf file that i want to print in color page and then to sign it with ink pen with specific signature

title: UX/UI Designer (Vietnam/Bangkok)
description: We are a team of passionate software engineers, product managers, and designers that enjoy building outstanding web and mobile applications.Millions of people use our apps. We work for companies of all sizes; from 1-person startups to Fortune 500 enterprises. We take a collaborative and product development approach, creating custom software that people will love to use and solving our clients problems so that they can focus on what they do best - better.If you want to grow together, work on challenging products and enjoy using the best tools and practices, Nimble is the right place for you! We keep our recruitment process practical and straightforward.To learn more about how we work, check our handbook named Compass, Github organization, and Medium account.Want to see what we have built? Check our Dribbble and Behance accounts.Want to keep in touch with us? Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.What You Will Do You will work in a project squad with a Product Owner and a development team (2-3 developers). Work closely with the Product Owner to make sure the product vision is aligned with the clients needs and assist in design discussions with clients. Most of the client interfacing is done by the Product Owner. Design beautiful and usable world-class web and mobile applications for our clients. Create User Journeys, Workflows, and Wireframes for the product we build for our clients. Perform User Experience Research to maximize the market-fit of the product we build for our clients. Learn new tools and techniques so that you are able to adapt to the evolving needs of our clients. Collaborate with other team members to define the internal processes and initiatives to help the company accomplish its mission. Our handbook has been written by the whole team. Why Youll Love Working Here You will be proud of any product that has our name on it. We are an engineering-focused company. Both co-founders are software engineers and led the tech teams at the most prominent e-commerce powerhouses in South East Asia. We really pay attention and care about processes, high quality, and aesthetics. Strong processes. We not only believe but also really work following agile principles. Developers work on well-sized and well-defined user stories, do estimate using points and work iteratively in short sprints (1-2 weeks). Regular one-on-one reviews to constantly improve and grow. We have a clearly defined process for our developers to level up continuously not only their technical skills but also soft skills. The vast amount of learning resources (Pluralsight, Pragpub, Leanpub, (e-)books, etc.) and yearly education allowance to step up your game. Nimble Growth session to invest time in acquiring new skills, work on new technology to improve our process, and share the achievements. Private medical insurance (Liberty) from day one, company care fund and social welfare coverage. Great equipment consisting of a MacBook, large screens, and any accessory to let you work comfortably. Our equipment is renewed every 3 years. Casual work attire for everyone. Comfortable and modern office space environment in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City and Da Nang. Our office kitchen is fully stocked with drinks and snacks for the team. Visa and work permit for foreigners. If you live abroad, we provide a relocation assistance package consisting of a plane ticket allowance and up to 2 weeks of initial accommodation. 26 days of paid leaves/year (11 public holidays + 15 personal days). Sabbatical month every 3 years. Company outing every year. And many more perks! Check it out here! Job Requirements At least 3 years of professional design experience. Ability to work independently and take ownership of design projects. Master in your toolset: Sketch, Figma, Illustrator, or Photoshop. If you do not have experience in some of these tools, you must be open to learn and work on them. Constantly keeping updated with the latest design trends. Being comfortable working with engineers and product managers. Confidence in communicating in English.

title: Graphics Designer/Social Media Coord
description: Graphics Designer/Social Media CoordinatorThe Environmental Integrity Project (EIP) is seeking a graphic artist with strong social media and layout skills to improve the visual presentation and communication power of our reports, social media channels, websites, brochures, fund-raising materials and branding. The successful candidate should be skilled and experienced in creating layouts for long reports – both in PDF form and online -- with creativity, clarity, visual brilliance, compelling photos, and accurate presentations of data and maps. The candidate should also be adept at conceiving and creating infographics, short videos, digital illustrations, and frequent written content for social media to inform readers and attract more social media followers. The Graphics Designer and Social Media Coordinator will have the responsibility of conceiving, sharpening, upgrading, and unifying EIP’s visual presentations – including our logos and reports, web pages, fact sheets, fund-raising materials, E-newsletters and blogs. And the coordinator will be tasked with writing and creating content every week for EIP’s social media channels and expanding the reach of those channels.Qualifications: Candidates should have extensive knowledge of and skills in software to produce illustrations in both digital and PDF form, as well as short videos. These could include (but not limited to) Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Flourish, Webflow, and Photoshop. At least three to five years of relevant work experience and a college degree are preferred. Applicants should also have a passion for the environment and should be able to manage multiple tasks at once and work well with others. Compensation: Salary will be competitive for a full-time graphics designer and social media coordinator in the Washington DC metro area, but also based in part on experience.Location: The employee will work mostly remotely, like most EIP employees. EIP is based in Washington, D.C., and some employees choose to work a few days a week at our offices at 1000 Vermont Avenue NW in Washington DC. But this is not a requirement.Equal Opportunity: EIP is an equal opportunity employer, highly values diversity, and strives to create an inclusive workplace culture. As an equal opportunity employer, EIP is committed to employment practices that ensure that employees and applicants for employment are provided with equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other factor that is not related to the position. To Apply: Candidates should send a cover letter, resume, five samples of their graphics illustration or report layout work, and three examples of their social media illustrations. Email the materials to Tom Pelton, Director of Communications, Environmental Integrity Project, tpelton@environmentalintegrity.org and hr@environmentalintegrity.org with the subject line “Application for EIP Graphics Designer/ Social Media Coordinator.” The letter must include a description of the candidate’s experience with and knowledge of social media.

title: Web Designer
description: Studio III Marketing is a full service marketing agency with offices in Los Angeles, Austin and Tampa Bay. At Studio III, we see graphic design as visual storytelling that engages, informs, and inspires. We are looking for a highly creative Graphic Designer who can take conceptual ideas and create visual representations, primarily for websites.We are seeking a skilled individual to join our team as a Web Designer with expertise in Figma. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting and diverse projects that will challenge your creativity and expertise. Whether you prefer the flexibility of freelancing or the stability of a full-time position, we welcome your application.Responsibilities: Collaborate with the design and development team to understand project requirements and objectives. Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes using Figma, ensuring design concepts are visually appealing and align with client expectations. Utilize Figmas collaboration and version control features to streamline design processes and maintain design consistency. Incorporate user-centered design principles to create intuitive and engaging interfaces. Stay up to date with the latest web design trends, techniques, and best practices. Iterate on designs based on feedback received from stakeholders, clients, and users. Work closely with front-end developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs. Requirements: Proven experience as a Web Designer with an impressive portfolio showcasing your design skills and expertise in various design tools and software. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, information architecture, and usability best practices. Ability to adhere to reasonable deadlines. Up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, emerging technologies, and design techniques. If interested, send your resume and a link to your portfolio to Hiring@studio3marketing.com. Please include your freelance rate and/or salary expectations.

title: Sr. Growth Product Designer
description: Who we arePath is a healthtech company dedicated to making mental health care work for everyone. Path takes a patient-first approach, where treatment is more accessible, personalized, and effective. With Path, it’s easy to find a high-quality therapist or psychiatric clinician who accepts insurance and is actively accepting new patients.What we’re solvingOver 65 million Americans have a treatable mental health issue — that’s 1 in 5 people. Today it’s difficult to find a provider, and for those with complicated conditions, it’s nearly impossible to find coordinated care. We’re here to fix this.Our MissionPaths mission is to make mental healthcare work for everyone.The RoleWe are seeking a talented and versatile Sr. Product Designer with strong visual design skills to complement our Growth EPD (Engineering/Product/Design) team. Specifically we are looking for a unique Product Design candidate who trends towards Brand more than their peers. The scope for this role includes working with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Operations, Marketing) and effectively being the primary contributor responsible for extending our brand and Growth related products.As a Sr. Growth Product Designer, your expertise will help shape the look, feel, and functionality of our products and consumer-facing website, ensuring they are aesthetically pleasing, engaging, and user-friendly.We’re looking for a designer who is excited to combine user research, prototyping, visual design, and deep customer empathy with world-class design craft to build amazing experiences for patients and providers. This is a product design focused role with an emphasis on brand identity and visual storytelling.We believe in creating a work environment where creatives are able to focus on a finite set of priorities whilst maintaining a positive work/life balance. We will actively prevent role scope creep from happening; You’ll spend most of your time focused on our top 1-2 projects for Growth and we will say “no” to everything else. We’re looking for someone who is interested and excited to be an individual contributor. The company is growing quickly so if you’re a design manager, we’d still love to talk but the expectation is that this is primarily an individual contributor role today. What Youll Be Doing Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and stakeholders, to understand project goals, user requirements, and technical constraints. Conceptualize and create user-centered designs for our products, considering user needs, business objectives, and industry best practices. Develop wireframes, prototypes, and interactive mockups to communicate design concepts and interactions effectively. Design intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces that enhance the overall user experience. Create high-quality visual assets, including icons, illustrations, and graphics, to support product features and branding. Maintain and evolve design systems and visual standards to ensure consistency across products and platforms. Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and validate design decisions. Stay up to date with the latest design trends, tools, and technologies, and share knowledge with the design team. What We’re Looking ForAn ideal candidate would be someone with the following traits: Self-managed work ethic. We are a remote company building a highly focused, low overhead team. We trust people to get work done on their own initiative. 4+ years of product design and visual design experience, ideally at a technology company. Proven experience as a Product Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing both product and visual design projects. Excellent typography, layout, and composition skills, with a keen eye for detail. Ability to create visual assets that evoke emotion, convey a brands personality, and resonate with target audiences. Experience designing and shipping complex products at all parts of the product lifecycle, from early brainstorming to post-launch evaluation. Ability to form clear hypotheses around design decisions and lay out a path to validate them. Clear and concise written, verbal, and visual communication skills. This is especially important as a remote company. Experience with Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, or other best-in-class tools. Our TeamThe people of Path are what truly define our mission and determine our impact on the world. We believe in building not only a team, but a diverse community that thrives by helping each other succeed and grow and inspiring each other by taking on big challenges.For employees, Path is a 100% remote healthtech company and we’re HIRING! Were excited to bring people onto the team who are committed to raising the bar on mental health care.As Part Of Our Team, Full-Time Employees Receive The ability to work from any location within the US Competitive pay and benefits that do not change based on location 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year to focus on self-care Paid parental leave to support you and your family Medical, dental, and vision insurance through our employer plan Access to our 401K Access to an Employer Assistance Plan (EAP) through our insurance plan The equipment you need to ensure your home office sets you up for success

title: Contract Web Designer (Remote)
description: Contract OpportunityRate: $50 - $70 hourlyThe Gnar Company is a fast-growing software consulting company seeking a Contract Web Designer to work with our Director of Design on a contract-to-hire basis. Youll be responsible for creating outstanding user experiences for our clients gnarly software problems. You will work alongside cross-functional teams, which include engineers, product managers, and other designers, to produce designs that meet business objectives and are user-centered.Responsibilities: Conceptualize and implement creative ideas for client websites, as well as creating visual elements that are in line with clients branding. Develop wireframes, prototypes, personas, and user journeys Understand and create sitemaps to visualize the structure of a website. Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and the director of design to develop design solutions and concepts that cater to user needs and achieve business objectives. Prepare design plans and present the website structure Incorporate functionalities and features into websites Develop and maintain design standards and guidelines, ensuring consistency across all devices. Conduct user research, usability testing, and analysis to inform design decisions and optimize user experiences. Stay up-to-date with emerging design trends, tools, and technologies Help plan and conduct client discovery sessions Communicate and present design solutions to the client Requirements 5+ years of design experience (Experience working on complex applications are a plus) Experience responsive designing marketing and ecommerce websites Strong people skills, especially collaborating with clients Deep understanding of UX principles Comfortable working in a wide range of industries, clients, and project sizes Experience collaborating with a team, especially in a remote office environment Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and determine a plan that will ensure they are met or exceeded General design curiosity and a passion for making great things Experience with Figma and prototyping Basic understanding of modern web technologies, browsers, frameworks, and devices Excellent visual design skills Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues General understanding of modern productivity tools (Slack, email, Google Docs, etc) An online portfolio Based in the United States (Sorry, no sponsored visas) About The Gnar Company We help companies solve gnarly software problems. From small, one-person startups to enterprises, we help businesses level up their teams, hone in on their process, and ship the right features at the right time. You will be joining an experienced team, and will be instrumental in crafting our company culture and team values. We are growing quickly and this role presents an excellent opportunity to grow with us. We value a strong work/life balance, when you are off work it’s your time.Based in the United States (Sorry, no sponsored visas)

title: Senior Product Designer
description: About RemoteRemote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance. Check out remote.com/how-it-works to learn more or if you’re interested in adding to the mission, scroll down to apply now.Please take a look at remote.com/handbook to learn more about our culture and what it is like to work here. Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. You can check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor or look up the results of our candidate surveys to see how others feel about working and interviewing here.All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!What this job can offer you Take ownership of strategic design and user-experience decisions, and pioneer new functions and features that solve our user’s problems. Join a close knit group working on the Fintech space in our Payments team, serving a critical part of the product for our customers. Work in a user-centered way, to discover, define, rapidly test and iterate your designs. Work in cross-collaborative teams with product and engineering to implement new features and iteration - learning rapidly from seeing your work in the real world. Join a supportive design practice where you will help further increase the design team’s level of ux maturity. What you bring An advanced level of product design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments, fintech or HR tech experience is a big plus for this position. An impressive portfolio showcasing a clear understanding of simplicity, typography, interaction design and UI design Proven experience of advocacy for the customer and applying UX methodologies including user research and insights to your design. An understanding and appreciation of the practice of design iteration - you will always be experimenting, evaluating and learning. A systematic approach to creating and maintaining our design system Practicals Youll report to: Product Design Manager Team: Design Location: APAC / Americas by preference Start date: As soon as possible Remote Compensation PhilosophyRemotes Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.For U.S. applicants: Across all US locations, the base salary range for this full-time position is $98,000 to $122,000 plus eligibility for equity. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.We offer a generous benefits package to all full-time employees. Currently in the U.S. this includes: 401(k) plan + employer match, flexible paid time off, paid sick leave in excess of local requirements, parental leave, FSA, HSA, health, dental and vision plans. Click here for more information on our global employee benefits.Application process Interview with recruiter Interview with future manager Interview with team member Second interview team member (optional) Interview with executive (optional) Prior employment verification check (Read more at remote.com/employment-checks) BenefitsOur full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits are for all Remoters: unlimited personal time off (minimum 4 weeks) flexible working hours (we are async) 16 weeks paid parental leave mental health support services stock options learning budget home office budget & IT equipment How you’ll plan your day (and life)We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

title: UI/UX Designer at Alily.AI
description: Are you a talented UI/UX Designer with a passion for creating visually stunning and user-friendly digital experiences? Look no further! Alily.AI is seeking a skilled designer to join our team and take our app and website to the next level.About Alily.AI: Alily.AI is a leading tech company specializing in AI-driven solutions. We are dedicated to revolutionizing the way people interact with technology through innovative and intuitive design. As we continue to grow and expand, we are seeking a creative UI/UX Designer to help us redesign our app and website for an enhanced user experience.Responsibilities: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user requirements and business goals. Redesign the app and website to align with the latest design trends and industry standards. Develop wireframes, prototypes, and visual design concepts for new features and improvements. Implement smooth scrolling and animated effects to create an engaging and immersive user experience. Conduct user research and testing to gather feedback and iterate on designs accordingly. Work closely with developers to ensure the successful implementation of designs. Stay up to date with emerging design trends and technologies. Requirements: Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your skills and expertise. Proficiency in industry-standard design tools (e.g., Sketch, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite). Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices. Knowledge of responsive design and mobile app design guidelines. Experience with creating animations and interactive prototypes. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. A keen eye for detail and a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Stock options to provide you with a stake in the companys success. Opportunity to work with a dynamic and talented team. A creative and supportive work environment. If youre excited about the opportunity to redesign an app and website, incorporating cutting-edge UI/UX techniques, wed love to hear from you. Please email us your resume, portfolio, and a brief introduction to showcase your interest and skills. Join us at Alily.AI and be part of a team shaping the future of AI-driven solutions!Email: info@alilyai.comThank you for considering Alily.AI. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Design Manager / Lead Graphic Designer
description: 2 Towns is looking for a seasoned Design Manager / Lead Graphic Designer who will provide design leadership and expertise for our team. The successful candidate will help guide the visual identity of our brands, create compelling package designs for our products, and will oversee all design projects from concept to completion.This role consists of two important graphic design roles in the Marketing department; Design Manager and Lead Graphic Designer.The Design Manager function of the role will lead the design process from planning and prioritizing design projects with stakeholders throughout the company to organizing, assigning and carrying out day-to-day design work. The Design Manager works with a team of internal & external designers to effectively and consistently execute projects on time and at a high caliber that maintains and follows a consistent brand strategy and aesthetic.The Lead Graphic Designer function of the role will utilize their graphic design skills to create and/or contribute toward design work wherever most appropriate and effective in executing the highest quality deliverable possible. Provide relevant direct management supervision to internal Graphic Designers and direct guidance to the external Graphic Designer team.2 Towns Ciderhouse aspires to create craft beverages that are accessible to the people, utilizing the most advanced production standards, and quality Northwest ingredients, without being afraid to do things a little differently. Much like our product, 2 Towns as a company is fun, unique, and filled with energy. Our crew is what makes what we do possible, and we are committed to fostering an environment of fairness, empowerment, and security.Our ideal candidate will have a mastery of design principles, as well as a strong understanding of business and marketing concepts, which will be intentionally and thoughtfully woven together, with the ability to explain and justify their recommendations to stakeholders. Experience working both as an individual and leading teams to generate graphics for print medium as well as for screen.After six months, you’ll know you were successful if: You have developed a deep understanding of our company, processes, and family of brands and have begun to leverage your design expertise to lead our design processes and continue to build and polish our brand image through design. Design timelines are being executed more reliably ahead of schedule, and our packaging and brand collateral are noticeably improving in brand consistency, impactfulness, and effectiveness. If this opportunity ignites your passion for design and you’re excited to help grow and evolve our family of brands, we encourage you to apply!Required Minimum Qualifications: 21 years or older Education: College degree in graphic design or related field Experience: 8 years in a similar or related field Mastery of Adobe Creative Suite (especially Illustrator, Photoshop, In-Design, Acrobat) Familiarity with PMS color management for off-set press printing Experience designing marketing materials / graphics for business, consumer goods, or commercial packaging Experience working with a team to create project deliverables Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Business Apps (Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Docs, etc.) Compensation & Benefits:2 Towns Ciderhouse offers competitive wages that will be determined by experience and may include health insurance, monthly merchandise credit, 401k & profit sharing/bonus opportunities, and paid time off. Benefit eligibility is dependent on job classification and hours worked. Salary Range: $65k - $80k Annually (Compensation will be based on the experience, knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant) Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 5:00 pm (Hybrid availability after initial training period)

title: UI Designer
description: We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer from Mexico, Guadalajara - or remote in Mexico who will be responsible for the user interface (UI) design of our various contact data related products. The UI has similarities to CRM tools, but is focused on surfacing marketing and sales contact and company data as well as other attributes supporting the marketing and sales teams.You will ensure in your deaign that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design working with the front end developers and our business and product owners.The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering visually useful designs by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends.UI UX Designer Responsibilities: gathering the user experience design requirements from our product owners. Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes. Designing all UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, search boxes, tabs, and widgets for our digital assets. Adhering to style standards on typography and graphic design. UI UX Designer Requirements: A bachelors degree and a minimum of 2 years UI/UX design experience for digital products or services. A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms. Proficient in Figma, Adobe Creative and other UI design tools A team player but can work independently too. Apply on Behance

title: Digital Designer (gn)
description: SummaryWe are looking for a friendly and experienced Digital Designer to support our skilled and very passionate team of (UX) designers, storytellers, developers and 3D artists.ResponsibilitiesAs a Digital (UI) Designer you will be responsible to create engaging, inspiring and user-centered communication. You will translate ideas and wireframes into excellent visual design solutions. Our projects are diverse so your tasks may also change for every project. At the core your mission is to always ensure a high quality standard, consistently good visual design and individual design solutions – also within certain guidelines of our customers. As part of a bigger team of designers and artists you will have an active role in the development of the design work at demodern.Technical qualificationsLet the bullet points speak: Proficient in using design tools like Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite. Experience in designing Interfaces for apps, web experiences and games. Familiarity with (Atomic) Design Systems and alignment with the development team. Skilled in motion design mockups and prototypes. Ability to craft compelling design visions and deliver engaging presentations. Very interested or experienced with XR technologies, digital installations and emerging tech. Interested or experienced with 3D. Capable of handling and guiding freelancers to ensure successful project outcomes. Additional experiences in the fields of Art Direction, visual identities, typography, illustration, or any other personal passion is a bonus. Professional qualificationsWe would love you to bring: You have experience in a professional environment. Proven relevant participation in successful online projects. Conceptual & visionary thinking, in-depth knowledge of brainstorming and design processes. Ability to create visual concepts and estimate efforts. Ability to give valuable feedback and support other designers. Ability to collaborate and integrate UX, strategy, engineering, and management. Strong communication skills, German and/or English. Always up to date to current (visual) trends and developments. Curiosity to exploring new technologies. Our environmentThere is a lot of reasons to work with us. Here are some: Well keep you up to date with insights into innovative and disruptive new technologies You will work with a highly qualified and sociable team Embrace a diverse, open, and international company culture that celebrates individuality and promotes inclusivity. You will work with state-of-the-art software and equipment Your health and wellbeing is a matter of personal importance to us. There is various provisions from sponsored fitness to professional 1:1 coaching You decide when you work from home or from our office Get involved in amazing and innovative projects that push the boundaries of design and technology. About usDemodern Creative Technologies is a digital agency that integrates strategy, design and engineering to drive digital innovation and create outstanding immersive experiences. Our autonomous teams build solutions that look past the obvious. Here, curiosity meets computer science, self-taught developers mix with seasoned technologists and midlife career changers to learn from and challenge each other.Join Demodern and thrive. Together, our extra curiosity, innovation, passion and dedication overcomes ordinary. Together, well create magic.Well be happy to hear from you no matter what age, gender, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, religion, ideology or disability!

title: Senior Motion Designer
description: About UsOur lively digital advertising agency is seeking an experienced and talented motion designer to join our creative team! This person will help create short- to mid-length videos as part of our post-production workflows, as well as design other creative for digital and traditional advertising campaigns for our progressive political and responsible corporate clients. Responsibilities:Have a great attitude, a willingness to learn, and to work hardCollaborate with the creative and strategy teams to brainstorm, conceptualize, and execute impactful, client-ready advertising creative, often on tight deadlines Work on every phase of the production workflow from scripts, style frames and storyboards, color-correcting selects and stringouts from raw footage, to rough and final cuts Assist in the day-to-day organization, logging, and media management of new content Design motion graphics including kinetic typography, animation, and data visualizations Translate scripts/storyboards/creative direction into engaging, effective motion and audio Generally, assist the creative team in creating assets for digital and traditional advertising campaigns Qualifications: 4+ years of motion design and video editing experience, preferably at an agency Demonstrated familiarity with current 2D motion design principles, trends, and best practices Ability to provide and receive feedback in a positive and constructive manner Strong organizational and time management skills and attention to detail Proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite (especially After Effects, Premiere Pro, Audition, Illustrator, and Photoshop) Familiarity with the post-production video workflow, including content sourcing, organization, editing, color correction, sound mixing, and delivery Experience working with both raw footage and stock Strong sense of timing, typography, and color Experience working independently or with a team on multiple competing tasks and demands in a fast-paced environment Experience designing advertising creative is a plus (but not a prerequisite), especially in progressive politics or advocacy Benefits:C+K offers a full benefits package that includes: medical insurance (Platinum-level reference plan is 100% paid by employer), options for dental and vision insurance, 401(k) with company contribution, short-term disability, flexible spending accounts, transportation benefits, paid time off, and paid holidays, among other benefits. C+K is an equal opportunity employer.Location:This position is remote within the continental United States, or in-office (including flex schedules between office/home) in Washington, DC (a small number of location exclusions apply). At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas and require non-temporary authorization to work in the US.Compensation:Compensation is commensurate with experience and skills, but our compensation assumption for this position is a base salary of $80k-89k with significant bonuses based on company and individual performance (averaging 1-3 months salary).How to Apply:Please send your résumé, cover letter, and a link to a portfolio/reel that includes 5-15 samples of your best work to artcareers@chongandkoster.com. Any additional non-video creative you would like to show us is also welcome.

title: Midweight Designer
description: Full time / Hybrid working (Studio 3 days per week)As a Midweight Designer you will be at the heart of our creative output. Creating work that drives projects forward, you will be relied upon to answer design briefs with creative solutions to a high standard. Working with and reporting to the Creative Director, but also across our entire team to ensure we meet our shared objectives.You’ll have a love for creativity, bringing ideas, energy and solid design skills to any task; from immersion, to strategy, to expression and implementation. You’re ready for more: more responsibility, more experimentation, more of a challenge and more room to grow and develop.The successful candidate will be joining an ambitious, independent agency full of driven and passionate people. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, and this role will involve both internal and external collaboration.As Designer, you will have the ability to: Question and challenge briefs, and solve problems creatively Generate ideas and interesting creative work with strong conceptual foundations and strategies to exceed expectations and motivate others to do the same Provide valuable input across all stages of a project from immersion to implementation Take responsibility to hit deadlines, be aware of timings and being punctual while working efficiently on multiple projects Prepare and present work. Working directly with creative leads to build out proposals, pitches, and presentations Keep on top of your game, in a creative world that is always changing Present work to clients and explain, discuss, and justify design decisions and respond constructively and creatively to feedback Collaborative and excited to share ideas as well as work independently. Encourage an open and collaborative working culture Positive attitude, excited about creativity with a willingness to grow We’d like you to bring: 5+ years experience in a reputable agency environment, with experience of successful digital projects, working on pitch decks or print work that you can demonstrate through an online portfolio of work Your portfolio should reflect an exceptional foundation of design principles and how they translate into digital mediums Experience with UX deliverables such as user journeys, flows, sitemaps, wireframes and interactive prototypes. A strong focus on a user-centric approach. People are at the heart of everything we do. Designing for real people is what inspires us. A strong understanding of visual systems, interaction patterns, and established user behaviours. You know the rules and when to break them to better serve the user Able to work with users/clients to understand their needs, pain points and to identify opportunities for improvement A clear communicator. Capable of conveying ideas and breaking down concepts clearly to a diverse range of stakeholders (verbally and written) High standards for craft. Able to understand the importance of small details and believing that we don’t settle, we push for only the best creative work. An advanced proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as Figma, InVision and Adobe CS Experience in animation, motion theory a bonus As part of our team, you get: 28 days paid annual leave plus your birthday off Flexible and hybrid working options Health insurance for you and your immediate family Team events and celebrations £1,000 annual training budget Apple laptop The interview Selected applicants will be invited for an interview. A task will be set and you will need to present your work to the team.

So I implored a services of any qualify Arts, Crafts Photographic with Sculptor Designer, that can make a beautiful design for auditions.
